# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the `wrap_string` function in Julia which wraps the text based on the specified `text_width`.

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s)
    line = ""
    output = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            output *= line * "\n"
            line = word
        else
            if !isempty(line)
                line *= " "
            end
            line *= word
        end
    end
    
    output *= line
    return output
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
text = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog"
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 15)
println(wrapped_text)
```

The above would produce something like:

```
The quick brown
fox jumps over
the lazy dog
```
